definition: stock that has potential to increase in value/(fig.) sb with good prospects

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

sentences.english: Firms currently identify high-flyers without the support of a guidance strategy. A.
sentences.chinese: 公司現在沒有在指導策略的支持下辨別潛力股。

sentences.english: Managers need expert assistance from within their own firms in developing high-flyers. D.
sentences.chinese: 開發潛力股，經理們需要在公司內部得到專家支持。

sentences.english: Organizations need to look beyond the high-flyers they are currently developing. D.
sentences.chinese: 組織必須把目光投向正在培養中的潛力股以外的地方。

definition: "Mr Perfect" (i.e. tall, rich and handsome) (Internet slang)
a fish that escaped the net (idiom)/(fig.) sb or sth that slips through the net
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to be green with envy (neologism c. 2009)
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
